titleStmt.title: Edinburgh, the second day of February, one thousand six hundred and sixty four. Forasmuch as the lords of his Majesties Privy Council, taking to their consideration, the great advantage and profit will redound to the lieges of this Kingdom, by keeping of the time of Lent ...

titleStmt.title: Edinburgh, the second day of February, one thousand six hundred and sixty four. Forasmuch as the lords of his Majesties Privy Council, taking to their consideration, the great advantage and profit will redound to the lieges of this Kingdom, by keeping of the time of Lent ...

notesStmt.note: Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Signed at end: Pet. Wedderburne, Cl. Sti. Concilii.
Proclamation prohibiting the eating of flesh in Lent.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
